title: US-China trade tensions ease after Trump-Xi APEC meeting | The World | ABC NEWS
description: US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping have held talks on the sidelines of the APEC summit in South Korea, marking the first meeting between the two leaders in six years.  Harvard Kennedy School US-Asia relations chair Rana Mitter unpacks the highly-anticipated talks. title: Andrew stripped of 'Prince' title and told to leave Royal Lodge | ABC NEWS
description: King Charles will strip Prince Andrew of his royal titles and will surrender the lease of his Royal Lodge on the grounds of Windsor. He will now be known as Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor and not as a prince. Andrew has been under renewed pressure over his relations with the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. title: How Melbourne became the 'crime capital' | ABC News Daily podcast
description: Home invasions, stabbing attacks and carjackings.   A wave of serious and violent crimes in Victoria have sparked concern about safety in the state.    But is it right for the federal opposition leader to label Melbourne ‘the crime capital of Australia’?   Today, ABC Melbourne Mornings presenter Raf Epstein on what’s going on in the nation’s second most populous state and the divisive political debate around it.    Featured:    Rafael Epstein, host of ABC Melbourne Mornings

description: Hundreds of thousands of Israel’s conservative ultra-Orthodox Jewish community have shut down one of the country’s busiest junctions, protesting moves to force them to serve in the military. title: Royal commentator says Andrew should be 'talking to the Metropolitan Police' | ABC News
description: King Charles will strip Prince Andrew of his royal titles and remove him from the Royal Lodge on the grounds of Windsor.  The announcement was made by Buckingham Palace.  The statement said formal notice was given to Andrew that he would need to surrender the lease of his mansion and move to private accommodation.  He will now be known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor and not as a prince.  Royal commentator Juliet Rieden tells News Breakfast that this is a 'victory for Virginia Giuffre' and that the man formerly known as Prince Andrew should 'pick up the baton and do the right thing'. title: How historians view the King's actions against his brother Andrew | ABC NEWS
description: King Charles has bowed to public pressure and stripped his brother Andrew of his royal titles and evicted him from the Royal Lodge, where he's lived for a quarter of a century. Historians say while it's a remarkable act by the King, it's not unprecedented. Associate Professor Cindy McCreery believes it's a humiliating blow for Andrew, but says the King is acting to secure the future of the monarchy. title: No sign of missing jewels despite more Louvre heist arrests | ABC NEWS
description: French authorities have admitted they're no closer to recovering the stolen jewels from the Louvre in Paris, despite more arrests over October's brazen heist. A further five people have been detained, bringing the total number of arrests to seven. Prosecutors say DNA evidence linked the main suspect to the theft and they hope the other individuals in custody will help them with information about the robbery.
